Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: Improved listening, speaking, writing, and reading in German
A much better grasp of German language and culture.
I learnt how to build up my communication and listening skills in particular. It was helpful to learn more vocabulary, especially around advanced topics like nationalism.
My german spelling and grammar improved a great deal

Great course overall! Can't think of of any suggestions for improvements. Classroom activities were all very varied and interesting (ranging from watching movies, playing board games in German, classroom debates, and also more generic grammar and reading exercises). Theresa was great: super friendly, helpful, clear at teaching, responsive, etc. Small class also means you got close to your classmates and they were very fun and funny people
The course is very well taught, but the online exercises that are given are often stupidly mundane or unclear, as they are put up for convenience rather than how well they stimulate learning.
If you play your cards right, this class could occasionally feature a whole dog.

The strengths were the conversational practice it gave you. 

I think there could be more structured and rigorous grammar work and skills such as essay writing or introduction to literature.
The course would benefit from a different online homework textbook
Yes! If you want to keep taking German, Theresa was amazing and this course was probably one of my favorite hours of each day.
Yes, this is about as good as language courses get.
I think its a great course to practice your German but it might not always be the most interesting
Yes, the teacher is very engaging and it does a good job of getting students to practice speaking
